title: Schema for definition of processor fuses for Secure Provision Tool
description: Copyright NXP 2020-2025, Schema for definition of the fuse registers for Secure Provision Tool

shadow_reg_offset_int.title: Offset of the shadow register. `-1` if the fuse does not have shadow register.

lock.title: Information about register write and read lock. By default (if no info provided), the register cannot be locked.

register_id.title: Reference to another register in the file where the lock-bitfield is located.

write_lock_int.title: Mask of the lock register, that represents active `write-lock`. The value cannot be zero, supposing zero value represent unlocked state.

read_lock_int.title: Mask of the lock register, that represents active `read-lock`. Zero if read-lock not supported, supposing zero value represent unlocked state.

operation_lock_int.title: Mask of the lock register, that represents active `operation-lock`. The OP lock option means that the shadow register associated with that fuse canâ€™t be written with a new value to override the fuse value. Zero if read-lock not supported, supposing zero value represent unlocked state.

cpu.title: Name of the processor series or family or NPI, for which the file is valid

shadow_reg_base_addr_int.title: Base address of the shadow registers; `-1` if shadow registers not supported for the processor.

groups.title: List of registers groups. Registers are expected to organized in a logical groups.

registers.title: List of registers in the group.
